alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Clay; Clinton; Daviess; Jackson; Lafayette; Ray (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 1:56AM CST by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Daviess, southeastern Clinton, eastern Clay, Ray, Caldwell, west central Lafayette and eastern Jackson Counties through 230 AM CST... At 156 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Holt to near Missouri City to near Lake Tapawingo. Movement was northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Blue Springs, Grain Valley, Excelsior Springs, Kearney, Richmond, Sugar Creek, Buckner, Lawson, Lathrop, Hamilton, Orrick, Wellington, Lake Tapawingo, Polo, Holt, Henrietta and Crystal Lakes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 14 and 25. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 26 and 47. Interstate 470 between mile markers 7 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Caldwell; Clay; Clinton; Daviess; Jackson; Lafayette; Ray
